action.action-desc: Ms. Norton (for herself, Ms. Bass, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, and Ms. Lee of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Budget

form.official-title: To require a report on expenditures for contracts for advertising services, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Government Advertising Equity Accountability Act.

section.header: Report on expenditures for contracts for advertising services

subsection.text: Section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: the following information with respect to each executive agency:

subparagraph.text: Expenditures of the executive agency for the prior fiscal year for—

clause.text: all contracts for advertising services; and
contracts for the advertising services of—

subclause.text: socially and economically disadvantaged small business concerns (as defined in section 8(a)(4) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637(a)(4))); and

subparagraph.text: Estimated expenditures of the executive agency for the fiscal year for which the budget is submitted for—

clause.text: all contracts for advertising services; and
contracts for the advertising services of—

subclause.text: socially and economically disadvantaged small business concerns (as defined in section 8(a)(4) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637(a)(4))); and

subsection.text: The amendment made by this Act shall apply to the report submitted under section 1105(a) of title 31, United States Code, for fiscal year 2024, and each fiscal year thereafter.
